text: Radio Sonora is the state radio network of the Mexican state of Sonora. It serves 95% of the state through its 28 FM transmitters, making it the second- largest state radio network in Mexico. It began operations during the government of Samuel Ocaña García (1979–85). ==Transmitters== The state of Sonora owns 28 radio transmitters, the second-most of any state in Mexico, to carry the Radio Sonora network. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !
